inn1.comm: short and wide from Abbott to start, a poor ball. Finch goes after his cut but chops it towards the keeper first up. Good stop by de Kock.
straighter this time, full and straight, brings this back but Finch squeezes his drive to backward square leg for a couple.

bowled im. One down already. Too exuberant from Finch. But a beautiful delivery too. The perfect delivery to Finch, akin to Southee's ball against Finch in Auckland. Full, just outside off, and so Finch thinks he can hit on the up. But the ball jags back just enough to go through a massive gap between bat and pad. Sends the off stump for a walk. Magnificent start for SA.
full outside off, 136 kph. Lovely length, inviting some swing. Gets just enough away swing. Respectfully left
brings it back again. Moving the ball both ways. Drags the length back a tad, Smith misses his flick and is struck high on the back leg.
beautiful over. Lovely channels. Back of a length outside off, Smith goes back and gets his head over the ball to say that's enough for now.

wonderful batting from Warner. Rather full outside off, Warner checks his drive towards mid-off. Sees an opportunity for run and gets to the other end. A real classy single, something he has developed a lot since his finger injury
136 kph, these are good lengths, full again. Not a lot of swing and so Smith can easily block to mid-on
too straight this time, Smith walks across and tucks this down to fine leg. Out if he missed but he rarely misses

awesome stuff. Not a bad delivery at all. Back of a length on middle and off. He just backs away a touch to make some room and angle his bat to get the ball through extra cover. Just a punch for four.
brings this straighter, middle and leg on the same length. Worked to midwicket
a bit of a leading edge. 136 kph, down leg, gets a run to deep square

one more. Abbott has another. What a jaffa. Australia's openers have been bowled in 13 balls. Continues to be full on off and middle, but this tails back exaggeratedly. Goes through a gap between bat and pad again, and disturbs the stumps. Warner visibly late in picking the movement. Superb start from Abbott.
full again, on middle and leg. 130.6 kph, not very pacey but naggingly accurate. Blocked
good length on off, high 120s. Comes back in, keeps low too. Defended
128.5 kph, full and straight, some nip back. Bailey blocks
131 kph, good length outside off. A thick outside edge gets Bailey one down to third man
too straight to Smith. A good ball to most others. Back of a length on off or just outside. Smith shuffles across and flicks in the gap at midwicket for a couple
full on off, pushed to mid-off. Not much movement for Pretorius

Bailey gone now. Australia in all sorts. Bailey doesn't review, and rightly so. Plumb in front. Good length on off and middle. Bailey sees the length and stays back, but should have come forward because of the variable bounce. It keeps low, jags back in and pins Bailey plumb in front. Didn't have much chance once he hung on that back foot
128 kph, back of a length outside off, blocked.
126 kph, full and straight. Marsh's feet stuck in the crease, defended
131 kph, good length and straight. Defended to mid-on
poor ball. Drifts down leg and Marsh puts it away. A neat flick through square leg gets Marsh four
back of a length on off, Smith shuffles across again and works to square leg. Got to watch for that late inswinger
125 kph, the pace getting slower but the accuracy unerring. Full, straight and blocked to mid-on
lovely bowling, attacking Smith's pads and you won't hear that too often. Full on middle, the ball comes back. Smothered to short midwicket
good length on off, nudged down to fine leg for a run
129 kph, back of a length outside off, may have moved away just a tad. Blocked to cover
beautiful shot. Overly full on off, a rare half volley. The full face of the bat offered by Marsh, straight back to Abbott who parries the ball to mid-on. Saved four in his follow-through
nice lines. Fuller than a good length outside off, pushed towards mid-off. Head over the ball
131 kph, rather full again on middle and leg, a neat drive to mid-on, who is slightly deep.
good length outside off, keeping it there. Left. No slips now.
134 kph, fullish down leg, driven to mid-on
very tight stuff from Pretorius. Nothing loose. Full and straight again, a checked muscular drive finds mid-on
132 kph, outside off and full. Defended. Just one off
more signs of the slowness of the surface. Good length outside off, Smith tries to punch a drive through the covers but skews it to midwicket instead.
131 kph, nice line outside off. Smith awkwardly pushes to mid-off. Seemed a premeditated front-foot movement
extra bounce this time. Good length outside off, Smith shuffles across, looks to defend but some bounce takes the shoulder of Smith's bat. Wry smiles from both batsman and bowler
132 kph, nice lines to Smith: his off-stump channel which is slightly wide outside off. A thick outside edge to third man
good length on middle, 135 kph. thick inside edge down to fine leg

shot. To be fair to Abbott, it wasn't short enough to pull. But Smith had had enough of plodding about. Good length on off, he picks the length early and nails his cross-batted swat over square leg. No bother in trying to keep that down
dead straight. Full on middle, a neat straight drive hits the stumps at the other end
back of a length on middle, sits up for Marsh as he goes back and defends with his head right over the ball
pushed towards mid-on with the full face
131 kph, probably the first ball today that has gone to point, an indication of how accurate these opening bowlers have been. Good length outside off, cut to point
rather full this time, sweetly-timed drive to a short mid-off. Amla dives, fields and elicits raucous wonder from the crowd
back of a length outside off, pushed towards cover from the back foot. Another tight over. Lovely start
oh yes. Shot of the day. Aided and abetted by a filthy half-volley. Smith comes forward and creams his cover drive. Perfect
immediately drags his length slightly back. Not over adjusted, just a tad. Full outside off, and defended
good length outside off, steered to third man with an angled face
129 kph, fuller length outside off. Jammed into the off side
good length outside off, left alone by Marsh. Continuing those lines outside off
125 kph, a nice fluid drive to cover from marsh. These two starting to open up
superb. Full on a fifth-stump line, which is the perfect channel to Smith. Defended
135 kph, keeps a tad low again. Fullish on off, squeezed away to midwicket from the crease. Can't be tentative in footwork on this surface
back of a length outside off, Smith goes across and nudges one to midwicket. Not a bad ball
slower offcutter on middle. Makes sure it's straight so if it goes wrong, it has to be a very good shot to get a boundary. it isn't wrong and so Marsh defends
132 kph outside off, drive to short mid-off. Marsh looks to hit that on the up but again mis-times it
back of a length on middle, blocked.
a lot of flight on middle, driven back to the bowler
too much flight this time, 101 kph. Overpitched and Smith creams his on-drive to long-on
nice, 81 kph. Drags the length back, slightly shorter. Draws Marsh forward who somehow keeps it out
he'll be happy to get off strike. Absolutely struggled to SL's Lakshan Sanadakan in the Tests did Marsh. Drives this to mid-off
this man didn't though. Reads the wrong un and pushes to long-off. Superb player of spin
good variation but too short. Another googly, Marsh goes deep, may have read it off the pitch and punched to cover
loosener to start, floats this one full at 135 kph. Smith defends
132 kph, full on off, nice drive back to the bowler. Full face of the bat. That movement from earlier has ceased
good length on off, Smith shuffles across and works to backward square. Wants two but deep square leg is quick on it
wanted to test the middle of the pitch, the first we have seen today. Bouncer down leg, tennis-ball bounce, loops over the batsman's head
nice drive. Rather full outside off, driven on the up to deep cover
dhort delivery on off, sits up for Smith to swat to deep square leg. Rolled his wrists to keep it down
good length outside off, 135 kph. Pushed to point from the back foot
flat down leg, 80 kph. Misses his flick does Smith and gets rapped on the pad. Throws his head back in disgust
flatter, quicker, shorter on off. Smith remains calm and punches to deep cover for one
81 ks, quick outside off, flies off the bat to cover. Sweet drive
persists with a quick pace. Flat outside off, pushed to cover. Angled bat, gets one
flights this one up on middle, pushed back to the bowler
84 kph, tossed up on middle and leg, a bit of spin, not extravagant. Shovelled to midwicket

ah yes, shot. Not a good delivery on a slow surface. A short delivery on middle and leg, sits up for Marsh to pummel through midwicket with a cross-bat swat. Put away, just what you do when you're not fluent
back of a length on middle, Marsh hangs back and punches to mid-on
looks to go straight over the infield. Full on off, Marsh skews to midwicket. Just not a good shot on this surface. Definitely a slower pitch
good comeback this from AP. Keeping it tight outside off, steers to point
short again and shot again. A bouncer that doesn't get up at all. Back of a length on off, Marsh doesn't go back, pulls through midwicket while on the front foot
and now drifts down leg, worked to fine leg for a single
flat on middle, slow turn. Marsh stays back and has enough time to nudge to midwicket
lots of flight outside off, overpitched. Smashed to long-off. Shouts of "caaatch" with short mid-off in place too
overpitched outside off, googly. Skewed to cover with the direction of spin

quite close. Big appeal, but too much doubt, I'd say. Faf and his close fielders have a chat, and he decides to review. Nice flight outside off from Shamsi, it turns back in and hits Smith in front of off. This could be closer than I thought initially. No bat. Umpire's call? rRemember, there is a new lbw protocol. in force. Those new lbw rules aren't needed because it struck him in front of off and hits off and middle. All reds on hawkeye. The umpire overturns his decision. The key to that lbw was just a little bit of spin that helped the ball turn past Smith's bat. He played forward, but just missed it. A bit of movement does for another Australia batsman.
ah, beauty. Flight outside off, this one spins and beats the outside edge. Hands on heads

one more! Shamsi has two in three. Another one for SA. Head has a chat with his partner and opts not to review. Australia in tatters now. Another orthodox delivery, flat on off. The ball spins a touch and beats Head's outside edge to strike him in front of off. Was there too much spin? Would it have been umpire's call? Head did not pick either delivery. Australia have been left befuddled by a few deliveries that have moved, similar to their troubles against spin in Sri Lanka. This ain't looking good now. All reds on hawkeye, good call not to review
good length outside off, tapped to point.
full and wide outside off, smashed to the sweeper cover.
good length on off, worked to midwicket
bouncer, good change-up, well directed too. Wade gets underneath
too straight, drifts down leg and clipped down to fine leg to get off the mark
overly full outside off again, a nice drive to deep cover for a run
flatter and quicker on middle, Marsh goes back and works to midwicket
the wrong 'un this time outside off. Marsh hurries back and punches a drive to long-off

a bit of a streaky stroke. A wristspinner will always extract extra bounce because of the additional revs imparted on the ball. As a result, that sweep stroke os fraught with risk. Top edged to backward square leg, on the bounce
darts this flat outside off, steered to point
flat outside off, punched to long-on. Wade almost shoulder-charges into Shamsi. Absolutely no reason for that. Left his elbow hanging out
beautiful end. Gets this to slide past Marsh's tentative outside edge, hits him on the pad, but umpire's call oin impact with stumps. A bit of a muted appeal there
127 kph, full and straight, gets this to come back. Blocked
lovely channels on off, 137 kph. Nothing Wade can do but block. When he has been further up, Phehlukwayo has been good
nice shot. Good length outside off, a bit of width. Scythed but straight to Duminy at backward point
good length outside off, may have taken some pace off the ball. Wade misses his cut.
superb over. A maiden. Full outside off, smothered to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off.
the googly on middle and leg, Wade reads him off the pitch and nudges to midwicket. A long hard stare from Shamsi, Wade looks away
flight on middle and leg, solidly blocked
more flight, but this is the googly and is slightly short. Worked away to midwicket
77 kph, tossed up on off, another googly. Inside-halved to midwicket. Wade doing the right thing by keeping most out for now
short and wide outside off, Wade chops a cut down to the third man boundary. May have got there a tad late but four the result.
loads of flight on off, pushed down to long-on
that's a batter shot to this type of spin. Slow outside off, Wade gets low and helps a paddle sweep to fine leg. Safe
tripe. A rank long-hop outside off. Marsh rocks back and looks to send it into the stands but keeps low and he can only drag a pull to deep midwicket

nice stroke. Flat outside off, Wade goes back and punches this through cover. Pretorius labours after it, gets there but misses his attempt to pull the ball back. May have been surprised by the quickness of the outfield
pushed towards midwicket, Phangiso gets across and fields
90 ks, quick on middle, turned away to midwicket
another beauty. But not badly played. Played the off stump line. If the ball, turned back in, he has it covered. If it goes on, like it did, it beats the bat. Good batting.
flatter outside off, hurriedly pushed to cover
another googly, but too slow, and too short. Marsh goes back and works to square leg
no turn, slides on to Wade's inside edge. Almost gets through. One to square leg
overpitched outside off, drilled to Amla at short mid-off
the googly. Picks it nicely, short and wide, cut to deep point
good batting. Full outside off, steered past point for a couple. Played that late
short, back of a length and slow. Hammered off the back foot to mid-off
superb shot. Overpitched outside off, drilled down to the mid-off boundary. Uppish but safe. Nice batting
good length on middle, pushed down to long-on. Playing it nicely now is Marsh
beautiful batting. Awesome stuff from Wade. Overpitched outside off, Wade times his cover drive, and finds the gap through cover.
bouncer on middle, Wade rides the bounce, keeps it down and finds one to fine leg
flight on off, pushed down to long-on with the spin, easy single
oh my. Watch out. Flight outside off, Marsh hurries to the pitch with nimble footwork and does what he does best. Smashes it back with immense power. The bowler hurriedly takes his hands away
driven to long-off with the spin
shortish on off, Wade goes back and punches to long-on, good batting by these two
flat again, Marsh goes back, pushes towards long-on but Faf gets across from midwicket
almost goes through. A non-turning delivery on off, played back
flat delivery on off, no turn. Wade goes back and punches back to the bowler
use of the feet, gets to the pitch and pushed down to long-on
absolutely no trouble in finding six once he got to the pitch. Runs down, gets there and just flicks the ball in the air. Whistles over the midwicket boundary
slides on with the arm and beats the bat. Well bowled. Marsh played for some spin
flatter delivery on middle and leg, played back
more tripe. Short outside off, Marsh goes back and hammers his pull to deep midwicket, all along the ground. Rossouw at midwicket tries to field, but the ball hits his hand and goes through
flat on off, pushed down the ground for a single
flight outside off, a solid block
flatter trajectory outside off, no turn. Wade goes back, plays it back
Wade comes down but Phangiso shortens the length, not near the pitch. Hits the pad
flight outside off, blocked
another flat, short delivery outside off. Punched back
strays down leg, flicked away to deep midwicket
flight outside off, angles his bat at the last instant to find one through sweeper cover
flat on leg, marsh comes down and pushes to long-on
short and wide outside off, cut away easily to deep point
slower through the air, drags it back too. Worked to deep square leg
flight outside off, nice length. Wade blocks
flat on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler. Hardly any turn
full and flat, driven back again
slow through the air, outside off, Marsh opens the face to steer a ball to deep cover to get to a vital fifty. Quality innings so far
slow outside off, pushed back
darted on leg, nudged to fine leg
slow again on middle, worked down towards fine leg, one more
oh superb batting. Short on middle, sits up for Wade who pulls this behind square. Keeps it down, finds the gap. All requisites for boundary-scoring. Quality
good length on off, blocked
isn't great bowling from Abbott after a lovely opening spell. Short down leg, pulled down to fine leg

gone! Abbott returns to an impeccable length and line, and reaps a reward immediately. Massive wicket, massive moment in the game. Just goes slightly wide of the crease, a fuller than good length outside off. Marsh pokes and gets a thick outside edge to de Kock. Superb bowling. Big big breakthrough. Quality knock but could have done more
back of a length and width outside off, 135ks, Hastings late-cuts it  to the left of backward point, beat's third man's dive to his right. Excellent stroke. A+ for timing as well as placement
good length and on off, right behind the line in defence
turns away outside off, slightly short, chopped to backward point

Shamsi returns and strikes! Tossed up nicely and spins back into the right-hander. Hastings has a short stride as he looks to defend with a straight bat. He, however, looks to defend outside the line. Shami beats him on the inside and raps the front pad below the knee-roll in front of middle. The finger goes up, and Hastings knew he was gone. Din't bother to review. The tracker shows that it would take the leg stump!
skids into the thigh, diverted behind to short fine leg
loopier around off, opens the face and runs the ball towards cover-point
much fuller on off, straight delivery, defended
Wade presses forward and defends this well-flighted delivery on off stump
good length ball on off, Zampa opens the face and threads the off-side field with a drive

bowled 'em! The off stump is floored. What a sight for a fast bowler! Good-length ball angled into the right-hander. Then straightens and beats the skittish waft of Zampa. Abbott barges into Zampa's castle and takes him down. The batsman was probably aiming to run the ball through vacant slip. No dice...
back of a length and outside off, pushed down the ground to mid-off
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, blocked back towards the bowler
presses forward and taps this length ball from outside off to the covers
full and on off and middle, Tremain whips it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
rolls his wrists, the sweep is Wade's safety blanket. He takes it from outside off and hits to deep midwicket
breaking down the leg side, draws the batsman forward and beats him. Leg-side wide
straight delivery on middle, Tremain goes low, and unfurls a sweep of his own. Guided to long leg
slides on middle, blocked from the crease with a straight bat
pushed through full and outside off, front-foot drive to long-off
how did that miss the off stump? Phew! Shami has his hands on his head. Looped up, turns slightly, Wade pre-meditated a sweep, and lost his shape. Beaten
Wade succeeds now, sweeping a single to short fine leg
slinks down the track, meets a half-volley and clouts it down the ground to mid-off. Faf nimbly moves to his right and dives to stop the ball
pretty full on off, Tremain plants his front foot down and lashes it back to the bowler
short and outside off, waits and glides a single to third man
length and angling away outside off, shoots low, beats the wild swipe from Wade
and again! Wade pre-meditates again. Rushes down the track. The bowler alters his length - drags it short - he can't connect with the leg-side mow again

Wade mows a six finally! Shortish on the leg stump, Wade sizes this up and launches it over FB into the stands beyond deep backward square leg. FB leapt to his left, stretched his left hand, but the ball evaded him
flighted and full on middle, played back to the bowler
slower and spins into the right-hander, defended
sees some air on middle, goes low, and slog-sweeps over square leg
skidding across the right-hander, much quicker and flatter. Blocked
Tremain gives it a good ol' thump!  Down the track, meets the pitch of this full ball and hits it down the ground for four
slides on quicker on the stumps, blocked out
pitched up and angling away outside off, driven to mid-off, where the fielder fumbles and gives a single
full and angled in, the bat comes down at an angle as well. Defended towards midwicket
pitched up and angled in, shuffled across and poked towards the midwicket region
dragged down the leg side, wide
length and outside off, opens the face and glides a single to third man. Australia get to 150
he rolls his fingers across the offcutter, dips under the swing of Wade en route to the keeper. Beaten
good length and outside off, Wade attacks it. Goes against the angle and kerplunks it over mid-on for a boundary
good-length ball, breaking into the leg stump, hangs back and helps it to short fine leg
tossed up and spins in, deflected square through the leg side, more off the inside half
flighted on off, plants his front leg down the line and pushes it back to Shamsi
slower through the air outside off, blocked on the front foot. Good, confident stride from Tremain
he sits back to this full ball on middle and dabs to extra-cover
hangs it in the air outside off, blocked on the front foot. Well done, Shamsi. Finishes with career-best returns of 3-36
Wade reaches his half-century with a six. He dares to race at Pretorious. He pulled his length back, but the batsman still slap-pulled it over square leg
Wade paddle-sweeps this length ball to fine leg
good length and outside off, drives away from the body and sends an outside edge fine on the off side, third man was rather square
shortish on off, pulled through backward square leg for a couple
good length and homing in on off, played back to the bowler on the front foot
shortens his length on middle, camps back and blocks back to the bowler

Phangiso belts out an appeal for lbw, it's given! Wade wants a review, more out of hope rather than conviction. He's also Australia's last hope. Pushed through from over the wicket, starts outside off, and spins in. Wade goes low for the sweep and misses. Struck on the thigh in line with the stumps. The tracker shows it would hit the leg stump
skids fast on middle, run back to the bowler from the crease
pitched up on off, defended

Phangiso strikes the pad, again! Draws another leg-before appeal. The bowler isn't sure. Qdk insists on a review, and Faf goes for it. Inside edge? Replays show pad first! Tossed up full, drifts in. Straightens enough. It would have hit middle. Australia have been dismissed for 167

inn2.comm: full inswinger, hits the pad, as Amla shuffles outside off from outside leg.  Yes, he found movement, but this was definitely slipping down leg
almost yorker-length, swings into Amla again. He hurriedly jabs his bat down and digs to mid-on
full on middle and leg, jammed out towards midwicket
veering into the pads of Amla again, he cashes in this time. Sweetly flicking this leg-stump half-volley past midwicket
pitched up on middle, Amla shuffles across off and defends to midwicket
Amla moves across off stump again, defends this good-length ball in front of middle
good length and just a shade outside off, bunted towards midwicket
shout of lbw, Smith ponders and shoots down the possibility of a review. Good length and catches him on the shuffle, but it had pitched outside leg
full and angled away outside off, front-foot drive to mid-off
full and angling away outside off, whipped out to midwicket
too straight in line, picked away through midwicket
whipped from off stump to square leg, where there is a misfield
back of a length and angled in at off, Amla keeps back and punches to short extra cover

Good length, angles it in, and seams back into Amla. He shuffles across and back as he rapped on the back leg in front of middle and leg stumps. The finger goes up, and Tremain has broken through with the new ball
good length and angled in on middle, defended down the pitch to mid-on
swerving down the leg side, wide
full on middle and leg, firmly whipped through backward square leg
a bit too full and outside off, Qdk gets forward and crunches a drive, head over the ball, through extra-cover
Tremain retorts with a bouncer angling away from Qdk. Soars to the keeper. Too high and called a wide
half-volley outside off, Qdk is forward to drive another one through the covers
good length and angled in towards off and middle, defended back down the pitch towards mid-on
good length and in the channel outside off, ignored
tight line on off, tight good-length delivery. Defended
Boland goes wide of the crease and angles it into the right-hander.  Straightens a wee bit off the surface and passes the outside edge
just dies in front of Finch at mid-off. Back of a length on off, Faf hops and aims for a punch. Ends up chipping in the air, as the ball stopped at him. He survives
back of a length on the stumps, defended on the back foot
good length and angling away, outside off, defended square on the leg side
much fuller and curls into the left-hander, Qdk falls over on the flick. Pokes an inside edge onto the pad
twirls his wrists, whips from outside off through square leg
good length and angled in towards off, no room, Faf opens the face and check-pushes to extra-cover
short and angled in on off, Faf had ample time to rock back and pull over midwicket for his first boundary
goes full on the stumps, presses forward and drives straight to mid-off
fullish on off and middle, picked up and whipped handsomely through midwicket
back of a length on middle, Qdk steps away outside leg, manufactures room and cuts, but can't beat backward point
fuller and angled in, Faf stays back, seems like had misjudged the length. Wafted to extra-cover
pitched up and angled in, has a short stride and blocks back down the pitch
Faf skips out of the crease, this is pushed wide outside off. He reaches out with his hands, skewing it off the toe-end towards mid-off
Boland digs it shorter and outside off on seeing Faf skip out again. Slashes an outside edge in the air. Hastings moves in, but the ball drops in front of him
Qdk seeks to clear deep midwicket. He ends up holing out to the fielder. Shortish and just outside off, he gets inside the line. Picks it up and pulls crisply into the lap of Zampa
good length on middle from over the wicket, patted to the off side
short and angling away, forced to backward point, flew to Warner, who pulled off a diving stop
half-volley outside off, JPD steps forward and drives to the right of mid-off
good length and just outside off, angled down to third man
back of a length and angling away, run down to third man
good start, full on off. No movement, Duminy blocks.
ah lovely. Beautiful shot. Not overpitched, but full. Duminy lays into his drive bit finds cover. Delectable
good single. Full on off, driven towards mid-off, didn't hit it too well so the run is easy
good length outside off, 135 kph. No movement. Steered to backward point
overly full on middle and leg, driven down towards mid-on. Full bat face
flies down to third man. Short and wide, an offering to Faf who top edges his cut for one
nice length. Using his pace and awkward action to extract something. Good length outside off, a hint of away movement. Guided down to third man. Played
back of a length and straight, blocked
full on off, hardly any movement. Pushed back to the bowler
phew, superlative timing but placement isn't superlative so no runs. Drifts down leg, Duminy flicks straight to square leg
nice channel. Keeping it around off, defended. Just don't see Australia's seamers troubling SA without movement.
back of a length on middle and leg, properly played by his feet, soft hands. Another tidy over from Tremain
136 kph, full on middle and leg, Faf presents the full face of his bat to quell
a tad too much width. Shortish and wide, Faf goes back and slaps to cover from the crease
again, not that wide but Faf punches to cover from the back foot
poor delivery but some tidy fielding from short fine leg. Drifts down leg, worked down to that man who dives to his right
back of a length outside off, hit on the bounce to cover
back of a length, 143 kph, outside off, mis-timed down towards mid-off. Maiden. Another tidy over
good length on leg, 142 kph. Maybe a bit of an inside edge onto the thigh. Dot.
nice change-up, the bouncer outside off. Duminy sways out of the line
overpitched, 139 kph. Driven to cover. Absolutely nothing happening for the seamers. No slips, no movement. This lull in play suits SA just fine
down leg and Duminy gets his legs out of the way to flick past midwicket for a couple
ooh, keeps a tad low. Fullish and wide outside off, toe-ended drive to cover
nicely played. Overpitched on off, Duminy opens his stance and drives to mid-off. Still no run
good length outside off, Faf opens the face of his bat to guide one to third man. Easy
144 kph, good length outside off from around the wicket. Slapped to cover. A throw to the non-strikers end in an attempt to soften the ball
drifts down leg for a wide, 144 kph
overpitched outside off, Duminy gets there too early, ends up is-timing his drive badly to mid-off
138 kph, good length outside off, blocked into the off side
good length outside off, driven down to mid-off
good length on middle, blocked
crashed through the covers. Faf dances down, giving himself room and hammers his cover drive through covers. Sublime timing, a rare occurrence today
drop and run to point. Quality from Faf. Just clever batting. Good length but very close to off, soft hands, taps one to point and gets a positive response from his partner
an optimistic appeal. Full on middle and leg, drifting down leg but not before gets a thick inside edge onto his pad
full on off, driven to mid-off
back of a length on middle and leg, Duminy rolls his wrists on that and keeps it down, gets one to deep square leg. Quietly moving it along.

another short delivery which is no trouble at all on this because this surface does not have the pace to hustle batsmen. Faf pulls to deep square leg. Enough time to see it, pick it, and find one with ease
slightly leg side-ish, worked to midwicket
good length outside off, Faf opens the face to guide to point but can't find a run
138 kph, good length on off, pushed to mid-off from the crease. The run is still easy
144.5 kph, seems like 44.5 when it reaches the batsman. Shortish and wide, slapped to cover. Mis-timed badly, the bat handle turns in his hand.
good length outside off, pushed to mid-off.
overpitched outside off, driven to cover
good length outside off, 132 kph. Pushed to cover. Faf hanging back

dropped. An absolute sitter. Zampa the culprit.  Short delivery on middle, Faf runs down but is hurried by some pace. takes the splice and lobs to Zampa at cover point. Zampa looks up, tries to take it with the fingers pointing down but the ball bursts through, hits him on the chest and drops to the ground. Aargh.
played into the off side.
good length on off, defended into the off side
another good length delivery that is defended
played. Really good batting. 131 kph, fullish outside off, Duminy opens the face late and guides it through the vacant slip region. So late.
strays down leg, Faf nudges it towards backward square leg and scurries back for two. Did not want that there
and again, this is exactly where he wanted to get it. Down leg, Faf tickles it fine in the same gap - at backward square and earns two
fullish on off, chopped towards point
good length outside off, 143 kph. Pushed to mid-off. One
short, wide and put away. Duminy sees width, jumps at the sight of candy and slashes it in front of cover. Four more
shortish and wide, defended into the off side
good length on middle and off, Faf shuffles across and misses his flick. Struck right in front, but very high. A leg bye ensues
four more. Duminy taking over. Too straight, angling down. Worked fine to the fine leg boundary. Juist had to get bat on that, nicely executed
good length outside off, carved to third man
good length outside off, steered down to third man
nudged down to third man for a run. Another nice single
another single. Good length outside off, pushed away into the gap at cover for one
shortish and wide outside off, slapped to cover
short and wide again, Faf gets a thick outside edge on trying to cut. Gets it hurrying down to third man for four.
82 ks, still short on middle, played to midwicket
tossed up on middle, driven back.
tossed up on off and middle, not short enough to stay back but Faf drives to deep cover. Made one there
flight on middle and off, defended
full outside off, Faf gets right across and drags it to deep square leg. A manufactured run
full on middle, played back
superb timing again. Overpitched outside off, Duminy strides forward, leans into the drive and sends the ball into the gap at cover point. Nice, confident drive
overpitched on leg, driven to mid-on
ooh, out with a direct hit. Pushes to mid-on does JP and calls for one immediately. But Smith at mid-on doesn't pick up cleanly
shortish and wide, chopped to the sweeper cover.
too short. Flat outside off, sits up for Faf. Drags it from outside off to midwicket, who gets a hand on it
good delivery. Flat, quick. May have been the flipper. Still short enough for Faf to pull to deep square leg
nice flight on leg, kept out

straight to mid-off. I just despise that shot, but these guys apparently don't. Tossed up on off, Duminy tries to clear mid-off. Doesn't quite get underneath and ends up chipping his wicket away after doing all the hardwork. All he had to do was try to go straight and the margin of error increases multi-fold. Nonetheless, Marsh takes a simple reverse-cupped catch
loads of flight on middle and leg. "Nice," says Wade. Too full though, driven to long-on
85 kph, flat outside off, chopped to point. More chants of "naais, naais" from Wade.
yorker on middle and leg, 132.6 kph. Kept out
full and straight, keeping it tidy. Blocked
strays down leg, a wide, a free run
good length down leg, played away into the leg side for a couple.
overpitched on off, driven back to the bowler
drifts down leg, Rossouw flicks it away happily through midwicket to get a couple more
131 kph, full and wide outside off, hit to mid-off
well-flighted ball on middle, defended
tossed up further, full on off, backs away and drives inside-out to the left of extra-cover
slides on outside off, no turn, left alone
springs out of the crease and quietly blocks this one back to Zampa
half-tracker on middle, flipper gone awry, he makes it look worse, rocking back and middling a pull through midwicket
skids on, no turn again, goes back and punches it to the bowler
full and on off, tapped into extra-cover
a bit too full and outside off, Faf, having backed away outside leg, punchily drives it between extra-cover and mid-off
takes this from off stump and angles a single down to third man
good length and angled in from around the wicket, presses forward and jabs to mid-on
angled in, nips in further, draws an inside edge and sneaks away towards fine leg
full and at off, Faf carves it away square through the off side, even as the bottom hand flew off the bat
back of a length on off, Faf stays leg side of the ball as he punches out to cover-point
overpitched on off, Faf brings out a drive and drills it down the ground, to the right of Smith at mid-off
angled into the hips, tickled fine on the leg side, past the keeper for leg byes
back of a length and angled into middle and leg stumps, cramps him for room. Defended back to the bowler
rising short ball on off, Faf glides it towards backward point
floated up outside off, rocks forward and drives it to the straighter of the two men there
short and outside off, drags a pull to short midwicket, the fielder throws himself to his right to stop the ball
steered from off stump to backward point for one
shimmies out and meets a short ball. Pulled away to deep midwicket
pretty full and outside off, driven to mid-off
similar length and line, driven to short extra-cover
speared full and angled in from round the wicket, jabbed down the ground to mid-on
leaps back does Faf, gets on top of a short ball and forces it to extra-cover
good length and angled in on off, guided towards point via an open face
too full on middle and leg, whipped away square through the leg side. SA's stand-in captain acknowledges his fifty
bouncer outside off, Faf lets it pass before rehearsing a pull
length ball on off, backs away outside leg and hits it to cover-point
lifter angled away outside off from the left-hander, Rossouw is happy to let that climb through to the keeper
back of a length on off, Faf opens the face and runs a single towards backward point
fractionally short and outside off, does not come onto Rossouw. He seeks to force it through the off side. Ends up dragging an inside edge behind
pitched full and outside off, no shot offered
width outside off, Rossouw slashes it past backward point. Not all that comfortable is the left-hander. He wrings his hands in pain. Ouch. That finger must be hurting
full and outside off, played up to the covers
back of a length and angled outside off, jabbed into the covers

Faf has been given out caught behind by umpire Llong. There was a noise. Faf, though, calls for a review almost immediately, suggesting he din't nick that. Bouncer on off, flies past the right shoulder of the batsman. Daylight between the bat and climbing ball. TV umpire Wilson overturns the on-field call. And that's one bouncer for the over
guided past backward point for one
short and angling away outside off, cut strongly to Bailey at backward point
back of a length and outside off from round the wicket now, Rossouw rises on top of the bounce, punching to extra-cover
Rossouw advances down the pitch, Marsh is wary of it, pulling his length back and beating the hook with a cross-seamer. Rossouw actually bailed out of the shot at the last instant
chopped into the covers as he was cramped for room
shortish on off, punched out to extra-cover
angled in towards leg stump, eased to long leg
good length and outside off, Faf takes it on the up and drives it crisply through square cover
angled towards leg stump again, clipped around the corner for one
length ball around off, steered down to third man
back of a length and angled in at off, chopped towards point
sliding away outside off, pushed through the covers on the back foot

there was a noise. Did he nick it behind? Smith is quite excited. Not given, and the Australian captain wants a review. Sharp legbreak from Zampa, starts outside off and rips away further. Wade can't pouch it, Smith catches it on the rebound. Faf missed it by a long way. The noise perhaps came from Faf's bat hitting his pad
floated up on middle, defended
quicker legbreak outside off, punched through the covers
slower through the air on middle, defended
sliding legbreak, negotiated off the back foot
dragged short and outside off, du Plessis sizes up the half-tracker and nails a pull to the right of short midwicket
chopped to backward point
too full and outside off, Faf crashes it disdainfully through the covers

Faf finds deep midwicket! Dug in short on off, Faf shapes to pull. Doesn't hit it as well as he would have liked. Head takes it safely at the edge of the boundary. Faf falls, but SA have all but sewn up this game
greets him with a lifter outside off, ducks under it
bursts through the hands of Tremain at short midwicket. Fractionally short on off, rocks back and pulls. Tremain leaps, but can't hang onto the chance
legbreak, turns back in, punched down the ground
floated full on middle, secures an easy single to wide mid-off
tossed up full at off, played back to Zampa
skids on flat on off, blocked on the back foot
lobs a full-toss outside off, eased in the gap between covers and mid-off
pushed through on middle and leg, hangs back and defends to the man under the helmet
back of a length and angled in on off from round the wicket, blocked back to the bowler
floated full and outside off, front-foot drive to extra-cover
leans back and chops a short ball from outside off to sweeper cover
lifter, flies through into the gloves of Wade as FB ducks under
short on leg stump, pulled down to fine leg
back of a length and outside off, placed to sweeper cover
too full and outside off, driven to mid-off's right
jabbed to mid-on for one
tossed-up legbreak, blocked in front of leg stump
flat and full on middle, whipped to midwicket
lobbed up on leg stump, not much turn, defended on the front foot
sees some flight, dashes down the track and clouts it over wide mid-on
back of a length and outside off, plays with an angled bat and misses
takes it from outside off and controls a pull to deep midwicket
back of a length and just outside off, punched to mid-off
short and outside off, glides a single to third man
back of a length on the stumps, shuffles across in defence
short and outside off, jumps on top of the bounce and flays it through cover-point
low full toss on off, patted down to mid-on for a hurried single. The fielder splatters the stumps at the non-striker's end, but FB is well in. He clutches his hamstring
slides on outside off, punched to extra-cover
South Africa soar to 4-0. The birthday boys - Rossouw and FB - finish it off. Rossouw soars down the track, drills it against the turn through the covers
